Slugger Stance

Requirement: Unarmed or a weapon with the Unarmed trait.

You put yourself into a wide, stable stance and ready your fists for punching rather than defending. This stance cares only about you hitting hard; taking a few hits is worth the trouble.

Pros

Fist Fighter

  • Your unarmed damage die increases two sizes.

Slug

  • Your first unarmed attack each turn increases its damage die by two additional die sizes.

Haymaker

  • As an action, you can throw out a single, powerful haymaker. One creature within reach must make a Strength (Save) check of DC 10 + your Proficiency Bonus. On failure, they take 1d12 + Strength Modifier bludgeoning damage and are moved backward 5ft. The creature takes half damage on success and is not moved.

Punching Bag

  • You are resistant to bludgeoning damage.

Cons

Un-dodging

  • Your AC is reduced by -2.
